div.h2: Technical Program Manager, AMP Analytics and Data Products

li.title: Santa Clara Valley, California, United States

ul.li: Santa Clara Valley, California, United States

div.p:
Apple is seeking a proven Technical Program Manager to join the Apple Media Products Analytics and Data Products team.
The Program Manager plays a critical role in collaborating with engineering and analytic teams to design, maintain, build or enhance data systems. In this role, you will focus on how GDPR will affect IT & data systems whilst working with legal, business, engineering stakeholders to deliver projects upon this.

ul.li: 3-5 years of industry experience in a technical program management role, focused on big data
Strong technical proficiency - past programming, Big Data, Compliance, or GDPR experience a plus
Strong prioritization and project management skills, including timely and proactive communications of timelines, status, issue escalation
Significant hands-on experience and fluency with big data and traditional database technologies (HDFS, Cassandra, Vertica, and traditional database platforms such as Teradata)
Excellent communication skills, both written and oral, including the ability to convey complex requirements in a clear, concise and credible manner
Deep analytical skills, strong out-of-the-box thinking and a curious mind
Extreme attention to detail and ability to self-audit work
Strong understanding of media- or content-specific data models a plus
Perform root cause and impact analysis to investigate issues and make recommendations for potential solutions

div.p: * Support the identification of business processes and systems that relate to personal data and are deemed in-scope for GDPR * Perform a risk assessment to aid a risk based approach for the application/implementation of GDPR * Understand the internal summarisation of the GDPR requirements and perform a gap analysis of all Business and IT processes, systems, procedures and controls, producing a gap analysis reports * Verify changes to systems and processes and support test managers in the development of their test plans and test scripts * Plan post implementation support processes and assist in transfer to business as usual * Specify and implement data quality metrics throughout the data pipeline to measure data quality and detect anomalies
Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience in Engineering, Computer Science, Business Information Systems.

Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity.
